metadata.name: Area and Perimeter of Composite Figures with Circles
metadata.description: Find area and perimeter of shapes made from rectangles, squares, triangles combined with circles or parts of circles.

objectives.description: Calculate area of composite figures involving circles and polygons
Calculate perimeter of composite figures with curved and straight edges

prerequisites: Calculate area and perimeter of basic shapes (rectangle, triangle)
Calculate area and circumference of circles
Understanding of semicircles and quarter circles

canonicalPath.description: Break down the composite figure into recognizable shapes
examples: Identify rectangles, triangles, circles, semicircles, quarter circles

misconceptions.description: Including internal edges in perimeter calculations
misconceptions.probe: When finding perimeter of a composite figure, do we include the line where two shapes meet inside?
misconceptions.hint: No! Perimeter is only the outer boundary. Internal edges where shapes join are not part of the perimeter.
misconceptions.quickCheck: If a semicircle sits on top of a rectangle, is the diameter part of the perimeter?

misconceptions.probe: If two shapes overlap, how do you handle the overlapping area?
misconceptions.hint: Be careful! If shapes overlap, you might need to subtract the overlap. If one shape has a cut-out, you subtract that area.
misconceptions.quickCheck: What's the area if you remove a small circle from inside a larger rectangle?
